name: Month-End Closing SOP
content:
Month-End Closing Standard Operating Procedure

Overview

This SOP outlines the complete month-end closing process for the Finance team.

Timeline

  • Day 1-5: Preliminary reconciliations
  • Day 6-10: Adjusting entries
  • Day 11-15: Final reconciliations
  • Day 16-20: Financial statement preparation
  • Day 21-25: Review and approval

Key Tasks

  1. Bank reconciliations (all accounts)
  2. Inventory reconciliation
  3. Accounts receivable aging review
  4. Accounts payable aging review
  5. Prepayments and accruals review
  6. Fixed asset depreciation
  7. Journal entry posting and review
  8. Trial balance preparation
  9. Financial statement preparation
  10. Variance analysis

Responsible Parties

  • Staff Accountant: Reconciliations and journal entries
  • Senior Accountant: Review and variance analysis
  • Finance Manager: Financial statements and approvals
  • CFO: Final review and sign-off
summary: Step-by-step guide for month-end closing procedures

name: Tax Filing Guide
content:
Tax Filing Guide - Philippines

Monthly Tax Obligations

Withholding Tax (Form 2550M)

  • Due Date: 10th day of the following month
  • Description: Monthly remittance return of income taxes withheld
  • Filing Method: eFPS (Electronic Filing and Payment System)
  • Responsible: Tax team

Expanded Withholding Tax (Form 2551M)

  • Due Date: 10th day of the following month
  • Description: Monthly remittance return of creditable income taxes withheld (expanded)

Quarterly Tax Obligations

Income Tax Return (Form 1701Q)

  • Due Date: 60 days after the close of each quarter
  • Description: Quarterly income tax return for corporations

Annual Tax Obligations

Annual Income Tax Return (Form 1702)

  • Due Date: April 15 (for calendar year ending Dec 31)
  • Description: Annual income tax return for corporations

Important Reminders

  • Always file on or before the deadline
  • Keep digital and physical copies of all filed returns
  • Update tax mapping codes regularly
  • Coordinate with external tax advisors for complex cases
summary: Comprehensive guide to Philippine tax filing requirements

name: Bank Reconciliation SOP
content:
Bank Reconciliation Standard Operating Procedure

Purpose

To ensure accuracy of bank balances and identify discrepancies timely.

Frequency

Monthly, by the 5th working day after month-end

Procedure

  1. Download bank statements from all bank portals
  2. Export Odoo cash/bank transactions for the period
  3. Open bank reconciliation module in Odoo
  4. Match transactions automatically (90% auto-match expected)
  5. Manually review and match remaining items
  6. Identify and document unreconciled items:
    • Outstanding checks
    • Deposits in transit
    • Bank charges not yet recorded
    • Errors or discrepancies
  7. Prepare journal entries for unrecorded bank charges/interest
  8. Generate reconciliation report
  9. Submit for review (Senior Accountant)
  10. File bank statement and reconciliation report in DMS

Tools

  • Odoo Banking module
  • Bank online portals
  • Excel templates (for complex reconciliations)

Escalation

If discrepancies exceed PHP 10,000 or cannot be explained, escalate immediately to Finance Manager.

name: Procurement Process
content:
Procurement Standard Operating Procedure

Overview

This SOP covers the end-to-end procurement process from vendor selection to payment.

Vendor Management Process

1. Vendor Rate Request (Account Manager)

  1. Identify need for new vendor or rate review
  2. Create vendor rate request in Odoo (Procurement module)
  3. Specify: Service/Product, Quantity, Timeline, Budget range
  4. Submit for Finance Director approval
  5. Note: Account Managers can only see vendor roles/expertise, not names or rates (confidential)

2. Finance Director Approval

  1. Review rate request against budget
  2. Approve or reject with comments
  3. If approved, assign to Procurement team

3. Vendor Sourcing (Procurement Team)

  1. Send RFQ (Request for Quotation) to qualified vendors
  2. Collect vendor quotations (minimum 3 vendors)
  3. Evaluate based on: Price, Quality, Delivery time, Past performance
  4. Prepare vendor comparison matrix

4. Vendor Selection & PO Creation

  1. Select winning vendor
  2. Create Purchase Order in Odoo
  3. Route for approvals (based on amount thresholds)
  4. Send PO to vendor

Approval Thresholds

  • Up to PHP 50,000: Procurement Manager
  • PHP 50,001 - 200,000: Finance Director
  • PHP 200,001 - 500,000: CFO
  • Above PHP 500,000: CEO + Board approval

Payment Terms

  • Standard: 30 days from invoice date
  • Early payment discount: 2/10 net 30 (if offered)
  • Advance payment: Requires CFO approval
summary: Complete procurement process from vendor selection to payment

name: Expense Management Policy
content:
Expense Management Policy

Overview

This policy governs all employee expense reimbursements and company credit card usage.

Reimbursable Expenses

  • Transportation (business travel only)
  • Meals and entertainment (with business purpose)
  • Accommodation (approved business trips)
  • Office supplies and equipment
  • Professional development (pre-approved)
  • Client entertainment (within limits)

Non-Reimbursable Expenses

  • Personal expenses
  • Commuting to regular workplace
  • Alcoholic beverages (unless client entertainment)
  • Personal entertainment
  • Traffic violations and parking fines

Expense Submission Process

  1. Incur expense with valid business purpose
  2. Obtain official receipt (OR) or sales invoice
  3. Take clear photo/scan of receipt
  4. Upload to Odoo Expense module within 7 days
  5. Fill expense details: Date, Amount, Category, Business purpose
  6. Submit expense report by month-end
  7. Route to manager for approval
  8. Finance Director final approval (amounts > PHP 10,000)
  9. Reimbursement via payroll or bank transfer (within 15 days)

Receipt Requirements

  • Must be official receipt (OR) or sales invoice
  • Must include: TIN, Business name, Address, Date, Amount
  • For transportation: Grab/Taxi receipt, Flight tickets, Gas receipts
  • For meals: Restaurant official receipt with business purpose note

OCR Processing

All expense receipts are automatically processed via OCR to extract key data. Review OCR results for accuracy before submission.

Approval Limits

  • Up to PHP 5,000: Direct Manager
  • PHP 5,001 - 10,000: Department Head
  • PHP 10,001 - 50,000: Finance Director
  • Above PHP 50,000: CFO approval required
summary: Employee expense reimbursement policy and procedures

name: Financial Reporting Guide
content:
Financial Reporting Guide

Monthly Financial Statements

Required Reports

  1. Balance Sheet
    • Assets (current and non-current)
    • Liabilities (current and non-current)
    • Equity
  2. Income Statement
    • Revenue
    • Cost of sales
    • Operating expenses
    • Other income/expenses
    • Net income
  3. Cash Flow Statement (Indirect method)
    • Operating activities
    • Investing activities
    • Financing activities

Reporting Timeline

  • Preliminary reports: 10 working days after month-end
  • Final reports: 15 working days after month-end
  • Management review: 18 working days after month-end
  • Board presentation (quarterly): 20 working days after quarter-end

Key Financial Metrics

  • Current ratio (>= 1.5)
  • Quick ratio (>= 1.0)
  • Debt-to-equity ratio (<= 1.0)
  • Gross profit margin (target: 40%)
  • Operating profit margin (target: 15%)
  • Net profit margin (target: 10%)
  • Days sales outstanding (DSO) (target: <= 45 days)
  • Days payable outstanding (DPO) (target: 30 days)
  • Inventory turnover (target: >= 6x per year)

Variance Analysis

Explain all variances > 10% or PHP 100,000 (whichever is lower) vs:

  • Prior month
  • Same month prior year
  • Budget/forecast

Distribution

  • CEO, CFO, Finance Director: Full package
  • Department Heads: Income statement and departmental reports
  • Board of Directors: Quarterly full package
summary: Financial statement preparation and reporting guidelines
